title: fix(panel): Ensure panel layout waits for async footprints to resolve
description: Fixes incorrect board sizing and placement in panel layout by ensuring it waits for asynchronous footprints to resolve before rendering.
body:
This change corrects an issue where panel layout would run before asynchronous footprints (e.g., from an external      
library) were fully loaded. This caused incorrect board sizing and placement within the panel.                               

By adding a render phase dependency, panel layout now waits for all footprints to resolve, ensuring accurate board dimensions and correct positioning. A new test case has been added to verify this behavior.

title: Preserve forked package visibility (TSC-285)
description: Ensures a newly forked package inherits the same visibility (privatepublic) as the source package and fixes inconsistent behavior between the package header fork flow and the editor fork flow by passing the is_private flag to the API.
body:
### Motivation
- Ensure a newly forked package inherits the same visibility (`private`/`public`) as the source package.
- Fix inconsistent behavior between the package header fork flow and the editor fork flow so both send visibility to the API.
- Pass the `is_private` flag to the registry `POST /packages/fork` endpoint so forks are created with the intended visibility.

### Description
- Update the header fork hook `useForkPackageMutation` to accept an object `{ packageId, isPrivate }` and include `is_private` in the POST payload to `/packages/fork`.
- Change the UI call in `src/components/ViewPackagePage/components/package-header.tsx` to call `forkPackage({ packageId, isPrivate })` instead of passing just the id.
- Add `is_private: pkg?.is_private` to the editor fork implementation in `src/hooks/useForkPackageMutation.ts` so the editor flow also preserves visibility.

### Testing
- No automated tests were run for this change.

------

title: Add buildCommand support to tscircuit config
description: Allow projects to specify a buildCommand in tscircuit.config.json as an override for what to run during cloud builds, without changing local tsci build behavior.
body:
### Motivation
- Allow projects to specify a `buildCommand` in `tscircuit.config.json` as an override for what to run during cloud builds, without changing local `tsci build` behavior.
- Make the new `buildCommand` configurable via the CLI so projects can set it with `tsci config set`.

### Description
- Add `buildCommand` to the project config Zod schema in `lib/project-config/project-config-schema.ts`.
- Add `buildCommand` to the JSON schema in `types/tscircuit.config.schema.json` so schema validation and editor tooling recognize it.
- Expose `buildCommand` in the CLI by adding it to `availableProjectConfigKeys` and supporting it in `cli/config/set/register.ts` with updated argument help text.
- No runtime build behavior changes were made; this change only surfaces the config option and persistence.

### Testing
- Ran TypeScript typecheck with `bunx tsc --noEmit`, which succeeded.
- Ran code formatting with `bun run format`, which completed successfully.

title: feat: Add straight line deviation penalty to improve routing quality
description: Adds a new hyperparameter STRAIGHT_LINE_DEVIATION_FACTOR to the PortPointPathingSolver that penalizes paths deviating from the straight line between connection endpoints, improving routing quality and reducing path complexity.
body: This change adds a new hyperparameter `STRAIGHT_LINE_DEVIATION_FACTOR` to the PortPointPathingSolver that penalizes paths that deviate significantly from the straight line between connection endpoints. This encourages more direct routing and reduces unnecessarily complex paths. Key improvements: - Routes that deviate from the optimal straight line path are penalized in the A* heuristic - Reduces excessive path complexity (e.g., 33+ points reduced to 5 points for vertical connections, in bugreport28) The best penalization factor I found was 4, providing good routing quality improvements while avoiding over-constraining the algorithm. There were also some performance improvements in some tests: before: after: bugreport8 is now solver, before: after:

title: Add auto_jumper autorouter preset
description: Adds support for a new autorouter preset named auto_jumper and keeps a deprecated kebab-case alias for backwards compatibility.
body:
### Motivation
- Add support for a new autorouter preset named `auto_jumper` and keep a deprecated kebab-case alias for backwards compatibility. 
- Ensure the runtime validation and TypeScript types accept the new preset. 
- Keep generated docs and type artifacts in sync with the source definitions as required by repository guidelines.

### Description
- Added `"auto_jumper"` and deprecated `"auto-jumper"` to the `AutorouterPreset` TypeScript union and the `preset` Zod enum in `lib/components/group.ts` and related Zod unions. 
- Added a unit test in `tests/autorouter.test.ts` to validate parsing of the `auto_jumper` preset. 
- Regenerated documentation and type artifacts, updating `generated/COMPONENT_TYPES.md` and `generated/PROPS_OVERVIEW.md` to reflect the new preset. 

### Testing
- Ran `bun test tests/autorouter.test.ts`, which passed all tests (6 pass, 0 fail). 
- Ran `bunx tsc --noEmit` to typecheck the project, which completed successfully. 
- Ran `bun run format` to format the repository, which completed successfully.

the issue was that the core silkscreenrect don't insert has_stroke and I don't think we need it.

replaced the logic with if we have stroke width `hasStroke = true`

title: fix(layout): Correct group PCB layout for asynchronously-loaded children
description: Fixes incorrect group sizing and positioning in PCB layout when children with external footprints are asynchronously loaded, ensuring accurate bounds calculation during render cycles.
body: When a group contained children with external footprints, its bounds were calculated before the children's full dimensions were known, leading to incorrect group sizing and positioning. This was particularly noticeable in panels, where it could cause entire boards to be offset. This fix refactors the group's bounds calculation so it can be re-run on subsequent render cycles, ensuring the layout is correctly updated after asynchronous footprints are loaded. before & after:

title: Add `--ci` flag and extract CI build handling to `cli/build/build-ci.ts`
description: Add a --ci flag to the tsci build command that allows for CI-friendly builds by installing dependencies and executing project-defined build steps before the normal build process.
body:
### Motivation
- Provide a CI-friendly mode for `tsci build` that installs dependencies and runs project-defined build steps before the normal build pipeline.
- Move the CI orchestration code out of the big `register.ts` action into a focused helper to improve readability and testability.
- Support projects that declare `prebuildCommand` and `buildCommand` in `tscircuit.config.json` so CI can run custom build steps or fall back to sensible default CI options.

### Description
- Added a new helper module `cli/build/build-ci.ts` that exports `applyCiBuildOptions`, installs project dependencies, runs optional `prebuildCommand`/`buildCommand` via `execSync`, and returns either handled=true or modified `resolvedOptions` for the remaining build flow.
- Wired the `--ci` CLI option in `cli/build/register.ts` to call `applyCiBuildOptions` and return early when a project `buildCommand` was executed, otherwise continue with the normal build flow using the resolved options.
- Introduced the `BuildCommandOptions` type and switched downstream checks to use `resolvedOptions` so CI can modify runtime options (e.g. enable `previewImages`, `transpile`, `site`, `useCdnJavascript`, and `ignoreErrors` by default).

### Testing
- Ran TypeScript typecheck with `bunx tsc --noEmit`, which succeeded.
- Ran code formatter with `bun run format`, which completed successfully.

------
[Codex Task](https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_6960133e4bc8832e8305769b9209c8b3)

body: Eliminate the final alert() dialog and establish consistent inline error display across all file processing operations. This completes the comprehensive UX improvement that prevents workflow interruptions from modal dialogs. Key Changes: - Replace alert("No .kicad_pcb file found in the dropped folder") with inline setError() display - Ensure all file upload paths (drag/drop, file input, folder drops) use consistent error handling - Maintain user context by showing errors directly in the interface instead of modal popups ### Before: ### After:

title: fix: validate circuit JSON files to prevent parsing crashes and improve UX
description: Add robust JSON validation and error handling to prevent crashes from invalid or malformed circuit files, providing users with clear, inline error messages instead of application crashes or silent failures.
body: **Add robust JSON validation and error handling to prevent crashes from invalid or malformed circuit files. Users now get clear, inline error messages instead of application crashes or silent failures.** ### Changes: - Implement isValidCircuitJson validation with type guards and structure checks - Add JSON parsing error handling with specific error messages - Replace alert dialogs with inline error display in upload interface - Prevent navigation away from workspace when validation fails ### Validation includes: - JSON syntax errors (malformed JSON) - Empty/invalid circuit arrays - Missing required fields (type properties) - Unsupported file formats ### Before: https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d3cc7278-0e2c-43af-af94-ed93024825d6 ### After:

title: Add STEP fallback conversion to GLB for CAD components
description: Motivation Some cad_component entries only provide a STEP URL and there was no client-side fallback to render them as mesh models. Enable in-browser conversion so STEP-only parts can be displayed without requiring pre-converted glTFGLB assets. Use a lightweight runtime import of occt-import-js from jsDelivr to avoid bundling the OCCT runtime into the app.  Description Dynamically load occt-import-js from jsDelivr via loadOcctImport() and resolve the factory export at runtime. Add convertStepUrlToGlbUrl() which fetches a STEP file, imports it with OCCT, converts OCCT meshes into Three.js GroupMesh objects, and exports a binary GLB using GLTFExporter, returning a blob URL. Integrate a fallback into AnyCadComponent by adding stepGltfUrl state and a useEffect that drives conversion when a model_step_url exists and no other meshgltf sources are present. Add a module declaration for the remote jsDelivr import in srcmodules.d.ts to satisfy the TypeScript build and ensure proper cleanup of generated object URLs.  Testing Ran TypeScript typecheck with bunx tsc --noEmit, which completed successfully. Ran formatter with bun run format, which completed successfully. No new automated unit tests were added in this change.
body:
### Motivation

- Some `cad_component` entries only provide a STEP URL and there was no client-side fallback to render them as mesh models.  
- Enable in-browser conversion so STEP-only parts can be displayed without requiring pre-converted glTF/GLB assets.  
- Use a lightweight runtime import of `occt-import-js` from jsDelivr to avoid bundling the OCCT runtime into the app.  

### Description

- Dynamically load `occt-import-js` from jsDelivr via `loadOcctImport()` and resolve the factory export at runtime.  
- Add `convertStepUrlToGlbUrl()` which fetches a STEP file, imports it with OCCT, converts OCCT meshes into Three.js `Group`/`Mesh` objects, and exports a binary GLB using `GLTFExporter`, returning a blob URL.  
- Integrate a fallback into `AnyCadComponent` by adding `stepGltfUrl` state and a `useEffect` that drives conversion when a `model_step_url` exists and no other mesh/gltf sources are present.  
- Add a module declaration for the remote jsDelivr import in `src/modules.d.ts` to satisfy the TypeScript build and ensure proper cleanup of generated object URLs.  

### Testing

- Ran TypeScript typecheck with `bunx tsc --noEmit`, which completed successfully.  
- Ran formatter with `bun run format`, which completed successfully.  
- No new automated unit tests were added in this change.

------
[Codex Task](https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_695eca018a0c832eba7bb2dc4246a312)

title: update circuit-to-svg to v0.0.313 and update keepout snapshots
description: Updates the circuit-to-svg dependency to version 0.0.313 and refreshes the keepout snapshots in the project.

title: Fix PCB note primitives repositioning in panel auto-layout
description: Fixes the issue where PCB note primitives do not reposition correctly during panel auto-layout, causing visual inconsistencies.
body:
Problem
PCB note primitives (pcbnoteline, pcbnoterect, pcbnotetext) were not being repositioned when their containing boards were auto-laid out by panels. This caused visual inconsistencies where note primitives remained at their original positions while boards moved.

Solution  
Added _moveCircuitJsonElements method to PcbNoteLine, PcbNoteRect, and PcbNoteText classes to properly update their positions in the database when boards are repositioned during panel layout.

Impact
- PCB note primitives now correctly follow their boards during panel auto-layout
- Ensures consistent visual representation across all PCB elements
- Fixes critical rendering bug that affected panel manufacturing output
The fix aligns these primitives with the behavior of other PCB elements like PcbNoteDimension and PcbNotePath that already implemented this repositioning logic.

title: fix pcb port ids missing from traces at jumper pads
description: Fixes missing PCB port IDs from traces at jumper pads, ensuring proper connectivity in the autorouting system.

title: Make sure jumpers created during autorouting have internal connections and trace properties for connectivity map
description: Ensures that jumpers created during autorouting have internal connections and proper trace properties for the connectivity map.

title: Update Autorouter for improved keepoutsolver
description: Updates the autorouter dependency to version 0.0.247, which likely includes improvements to the keepout solver functionality.

title: Improve keepout rendering with diagonal pattern and transparent background
description: Adds diagonal pattern rendering for keepout areas with a transparent background in PCB SVG generation.

title: Add explicit viewport control to PCB SVG rendering
description: Adds explicit viewport and viewportTarget options to precisely control SVG render bounds, extracts viewport resolution into a utility, updates aspect-ratio handling, and adds snapshot tests for custom bounds and panel-targeted rendering.
body:
Introduces first-class viewport and viewportTarget options to precisely control SVG render bounds.

Extracts viewport and bounds resolution into a dedicated utility, simplifying and centralizing layout logic.

Supports targeting specific panels or boards for rendering, enabling focused exports and previews.

Updates aspect-ratio handling to respect resolved viewport bounds instead of implicit board geometry.

Adds snapshot tests covering custom bounds and panel-targeted rendering to lock in behavior.

title: refactor: rename isPointInBounds to isPointInsideBounds
description: Standardizes the function name from isPointInBounds to isPointInsideBounds, exports the function, removes the old implementation, and updates tests accordingly.
body: Standardized function name from isPointInBounds to isPointInsideBounds. Exported the function, removed old implementation, and updated tests. All tests pass.

title: add bun test and formatcheck workflows
description: Adds GitHub workflows for testing and format checking using Bun, replacing the previous format bot workflow.

title: feat: add isPointInBounds function
description: Add isPointInBounds function to check if a point is inside or on the boundary of a rectangular bounds, with comprehensive unit tests for edge cases.
body: Add isPointInBounds function to check if a point is inside or on the boundary of a rectangular bounds. Includes comprehensive unit tests covering edge cases like boundary conditions, negative coordinates, and zero-area bounds. Function follows existing code patterns and is exported from the main index.

body:
- Updated SidebarReleasesSection to conditionally render the link based on packageInfo availability.
- Modified getBuildStatus and getBuildErrorMessage functions to accept PublicPackageRelease type.
- Removed unnecessary latestBuildQueries logic from ReleasesList, simplifying the build status retrieval process.
- Adjusted status label visibility in ReleaseItemRow based on build success.

title: Filter unused jumpers from output
description: Adds filtering logic to remove jumpers where no pads have any connections, preventing unnecessary output of unused jumpers.
body: Add filtering logic to remove jumpers where no pads have any connections. This prevents returning jumpers that were placed in the grid but never actually used by any routes, reducing unnecessary output.

title: gameboy bug report
description: This pull request introduces a bug report for the autorouter functionality, including a detailed JSON representation of the bug and a corresponding fixture for testing.

title: Add DIP16 crossing traces test fixture
description: Adds a new autorouting test case for DIP16 components with crossing traces, including fixture, JSON data, and tests for both standard pipeline and high-density solver.
body: Adds a new autorouting test case for DIP16 components with crossing traces, including fixture, JSON data, and tests for both standard pipeline and high-density solver.

title: add bounds test for jumper high density, fix 3 major keepout solver issues
description: Fixes three major issues in the keepout solver and adds bounds testing for high-density jumper routing.

title: fix 3d pos and rotation for some 3d components
description: Fixes 3D position and rotation offsets for specific components in the circuit board models.

title: Improved the pcb panel test & updated circuit to svg package to fix texture bug
description: This pull request improves the PCB panel test and updates the circuit-to-svg package to fix a texture bug that was affecting the rendering of circuit designs. The update includes a new test fixture for the PCB panel and an updated version of the circuit-to-svg package to ensure compatibility and performance improvements.

title: Support cutouts in PCB panel 3D geometry generation
description: Extends panel 3D mesh generation to include PCB cutouts, not just holes.
body:
Extends panel 3D mesh generation to include PCB cutouts, not just holes.

Correctly applies global (board-agnostic) cutouts when rendering panel geometry.

Aligns panel geometry behavior with single-board 3D conversion logic.

Fixes missing material subtraction in panel meshes, improving 3D accuracy and test coverage.

title: refactor: simplify NumericControl by removing precision and enabling negative values
description: Removes precision handling from NumericControl component and updates min values to allow negative inputs for margins and origins, simplifying the component logic and improving usability for settings that require negative values.
body: Remove precision handling from NumericControl component and update min values to allow negative inputs for margins and origins. Simplifies the component logic and improves usability for settings that require negative values.
